metadata.intent: Establish master definition for character 'MEMORIZE THIS'
metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: MEMORIZE THIS appears to be a stage direction or on-screen text caption embedded within the script as a character label, rather than a true speaking character. It functions as a visual cue or title card — likely displayed on screen to the audience — labeling the outfit Dante is wearing as a 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT.' It is not a person but a scripted textual device attributed as dialogue under Cassandra's action block.
data.dialogue_summary: The single attributed line 'MEMORIZE THIS' appears as a capitalized stage-direction-style caption following 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT,' functioning as an instructional label rather than organic spoken dialogue. It conveys a commanding, authoritative tone consistent with the scene's power dynamic.

explicit_evidence.source_scene: EXT. SAK'S FIFTH AVE FRONT ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS

inferred_traits.rationale: The formatting and capitalization of 'MEMORIZE THIS' alongside 'CLIENT ENTERTAINING OUTFIT' strongly suggests this is a visual title card or on-screen label rather than a character speaking. It is attributed under Cassandra's action block and appears to be a directorial or stylistic device labeling Dante's outfit for the audience.

Alternatively, 'MEMORIZE THIS' could be interpreted as Cassandra's commanding inner voice or an aside directed at Dante, consistent with her controlling and imperious personality throughout the scene.
inferred_traits.value: Possibly Cassandra's implied inner monologue or direct audience address
